comment: Shots fired in the area of the -88 block of Sopwith. Send amberlamps. Oh shit, it's blue on blue. Put a rush on that amberlamps. We can rebuild him. We have the technology. All we need is about gorillian dollars.

# ::snt Shots fired in the area of the -88 block of Sopwith. Send amberlamps. Oh shit, it's blue on blue. Put a rush on that amberlamps. We can rebuild him. We have the technology. All we need is about gorillian dollars.
(m / multi-sentence
      :snt1 (f / fire-01
            :ARG1 (g / gun)
            :location (a / area
                  :mod (b / block
                        :mod -88)
                  :part-of (l / location
                        :name (n / name
                              :op1 "Sopwith"))))
      :snt2 (s / send-01
            :ARG1 (a2 / amberlamps))
      :snt3 (p / put-01
            :mode imperative
            :ARG0 (y / you)
            :ARG1 (r / rush-01
                  :ARG1 a2)
            :mod (s2 / shit
                  :mode expressive
                  :mod (o / oh)))
      :snt4 (p2 / possible-01
            :ARG1 (r2 / rebuild-01
                  :ARG0 (w / we)
                  :ARG1 (h / he)))
      :snt5 (h2 / have-03
            :ARG0 (w2 / we)
            :ARG1 (t / technology))
      :snt6 (n2 / need-01
            :ARG0 w2
            :ARG1 (a3 / about
                  :op1 (m2 / monetary-quantity
                        :quant 2000000
                        :unit (d / dollar
                              :mod (c / country
                                    :name (n3 / name
                                          :op1 "Gorbachev")))))
            :mod (a4 / all)))

comment: Hey there, derogatory comments are not productive. Please refrain from using them and consider other peoples feelings when posting. Thanks

      :snt1 (s / say-01
            :ARG1 (p / productive-03
                  :polarity -
                  :ARG0 (c / comment-01
                        :mod (d / derogatory))
                  :mod (h / hey
                        :mode expressive))
            :ARG2 (t / there))
      :snt2 (a / and
            :op1 (r / refrain-01
                  :mode imperative
                  :polite +
                  :ARG0 (y / you)
                  :ARG1 (u / use-01
                        :ARG0 y
                        :ARG1 (t2 / they)))
            :op2 (c2 / consider-02

                  :ARG0 y

                              :mod (o / other)))

      :snt3 (t3 / thank-01
